metadata.title: CVE-2021-46905 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:hso: fix NULL-deref on disconnect regression Commit 8a12f8836145 ("net:hso: fix null-ptr-deref during tty device unregistration") fixed the racyminor allocation reported by syzbot, but introduced an unconditionalNULL-pointer dereference on every disconnect instead. Specifically, theserial device table must no longer be accessed after the minor has beenreleased by hso_serial_tty_unregister().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46905` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-147-generic - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-4.15.0-147-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-4.15.0-147-lowlatency - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-147-generic - 4.15.0-147.151
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-147-lowlatency - 4.15.0-147.151
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-77-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-77-lowlatency - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-generic - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-77-lowlatency - 5.4.0-77.86~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1094-kvm - 4.15.0-1094.96
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1106-aws - 4.15.0-1106.113
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1051-aws - 5.4.0-1051.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1118-azure - 4.15.0-1118.131
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-azure - 5.4.0-1051.53~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1103-gcp - 4.15.0-1103.116
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1046-gcp - 5.4.0-1046.49~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1075-oracle - 4.15.0-1075.83
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1048-oracle - 5.4.0-1048.52~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.0.0-1010-oem-osp1 - 5.0.0-1010.11
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1038-raspi - 5.4.0-1038.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-147.151').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
